{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pure red cell aplasia is a condition where the body stops producing red blood cells. This can be caused by a variety of factors. ABO incompatibility in bone marrow transplantation can cause this condition, as the body may reject the new cells. Lymphoma can also cause this condition, as it can interfere with the production of red blood cells. Drug induced-NSAIDs can also cause this condition, as they can interfere with the production of red blood cells. However, Chromosome 5q deletion syndrome (5q monosomy) is a genetic condition and not an acquired cause.", "answer_choice": "D"}
